definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: The college farm has solar-powered barns, gardens, fruit trees, greenhouses and animals.
sentences.chinese: 学院农场有太阳能的谷仓，花园，果树，花房和家禽。

sentences.english: A water lily glows in the aquatic plants area of San Francisco's Conservatory of Flowers.
sentences.chinese: 一支睡莲在旧金山温室花房的水生植物区熠熠绽放着。

sentences.english: We're hoping to add on a green room and a guest bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 我们还想再加一个花房和一间客房。

sentences.english: I built it by hand and also added a greenhouse to the front of it.
sentences.chinese: 是我亲手搭建的，前面还有一间花房。

sentences.english: I'm gonna to build her a greenhouse.
sentences.chinese: 我要为她建造一个花房。

sentences.english: Recently I was visiting a friend who has a greenhouse.
sentences.chinese: 最近，我拜访了一位朋友，她有一个花房。

sentences.english: Measure the floor area of the greenhouse and divide it by six .
sentences.chinese: 测量一下花房地板面积，然后用得到的数值除以六。

sentences.english: To this end she went to greenhouse, but she was bosons tracked.
sentences.chinese: 为此她去了一趟花房，但是她被色子跟踪了。

definition: heating/central heating/greenhouse/hothouse/to pay a house-warming visit
balcony/patio/flat roof/terrace/deck (unroofed platform)/outdoor stage/ancient imperial celestial observation terrace
